greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let f(i,j) = Sum_{k=0..2*i} (binomial(2*i, k)*binomial(2*j, i+j-k)*(-1)^(i+j-k) (this is essentially the same as the triangle in A068555); then a(n) = f(n, n-2)/2.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Guo-Niu Han, Enumeration of Standard Puzzles, arXiv:2006.14070 [math.CO], 2020.
Guo-Niu Han, Enumeration of Standard Puzzles [Cached copy]
formula: G.f.: x^2*A'(x)*G(A(x))/A(x), where A(x) = x*(1+sqrt(1+4*x))/2, G(x) =(2*cosh(asinh((3^(3/2)*sqrt(x))/2)/3)*sinh(asinh((3^(3/2)*sqrt(x))/2)/3)*sqrt(x))/(sqrt(3)*sqrt((27*x)/4+1))+(4*sinh(asinh((3^(3/2)*sqrt(x))/2)/3)^2)/3+1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Dec 16 2016
mathematica: s = (Sqrt[4*x+1]*(4*x^2+x) + 6*x^2 + x)/(Sqrt[4*x+1] + 4*x+1) + O[x]^28; CoefficientList[s, x] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 17 2016, after _Vladimir Kruchinin_ *)
program: (PARI) concat([0,1], for(n=2,25, print1(sum(k=0,2*n, (1/2)* binomial(2*n,k)* binomial(2*( n-2),2*n-k-2)*(-1)^(2*n-k-2)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2017
xref: Cf. A068555. Apart perhaps from signs, f(n, 0) and f(n, n) give A000984, f(n, 1) gives A002420, f(n, n-1) gives 2*A000984.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 20 2002
